body:
Hello, I'm sorry you are having trouble. I'm not sure why it is not working for you. I tried out your example code above and I got a range response with a simple app:
```js
const express = require('express')
const path = require('path')
const app = express()

app.get('/:filename', function(req, res) {
  var filePath = path.join(__dirname, 'Readme.md')
  res.download(filePath, 'README.MD')
})

app.listen(3000)
```

```
$ curl -i -H'Range: bytes=0-10' http://localhost:3000/foo
HTTP/1.1 206 Partial Content
X-Powered-By: Express
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="README.MD"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Cache-Control: public, max-age=0
Last-Modified: Wed, 02 Feb 2022 07:43:19 GMT
ETag: W/"12cb-17eb9634b3b"
Content-Type: text/markdown; charset=UTF-8
Content-Range: bytes 0-10/4811
Content-Length: 11
Date: Wed, 02 Feb 2022 20:14:33 GMT
Connection: keep-alive
Keep-Alive: timeout=5

[![Express
```

I also added tests to our test suite that also verify range functionality with the `res.download` API: https://github.com/expressjs/express/commit/da6cb0ed8a4c9a5048cf391a32f9fab1960d9284
